00066 
00075 template <typename IteratorA, typename IteratorB>
00076 inline ptrdiff_t distance( IteratorA first, IteratorB last )
00077 {
00078     ptrdiff_t n = 0;
00079     while ( first != last )
00080     {
00081         ++first;
00082         ++n;
00083     }
00084     
00085     return n;
00086 }

00095 {
00096 public:
00097 
00099     typedef cache_table<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>                table;
00100 
00102     typedef cache_table_iterator<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>       iterator;
00103 
00105     typedef cache_table_const_iterator<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A> const_iterator;
00106 
00108     typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00109 
00111     typedef ptrdiff_t                       difference_type;
00112 
00114     typedef V&                              reference;
00115 
00117     typedef V*                              pointer;
00118 
00120     typedef K                               key_type;
00121 
00123     typedef V                               value_type;
00124 
00126     typedef typename table::size_type       size_type;
00127     
00128 private:
00129 
00139     cache_table_iterator( const table* table, pointer it )
00140         : m_ht( table ), 
00141           m_pos( it )
00142     {}
00143     
00153     cache_table_iterator( const table* table, pointer it,
00154                           bool advance_to_next )
00155         : m_ht( table ), 
00156           m_pos( it )
00157     {
00158         if ( advance_to_next )
00159             advance_to_next_item();
00160     }
00161     
00162 public:
00163 
00167     cache_table_iterator()
00168         : m_ht( 0 ),
00169           m_pos( 0 )
00170     {}
00171     
00176     cache_table_iterator( const cache_table_iterator& it )
00177         : m_ht(  it.m_ht  ), 
00178           m_pos( it.m_pos )
00179     {}
00180 
00185     reference operator*() const { return *m_pos; }
00186     
00191     pointer operator->()  const { return &(operator*()); }
00192 
00198     iterator& operator++()
00199     {
00200         ++m_pos;
00201         advance_to_next_item();
00202         return *this;
00203     }
00204 
00210     iterator operator++(int) { iterator tmp(*this); ++*this; return tmp; }
00211             
00217     bool operator==( const iterator& it ) const { return m_pos == it.m_pos; }
00218 
00224     bool operator!=( const iterator& it ) const { return m_pos != it.m_pos; }
00225         
00226 private:
00227 
00229     void advance_to_next_item()
00230     {
00231         while ( m_pos < m_ht->m_end_marker && m_ht->is_empty_key( m_pos ) )
00232             ++m_pos;
00233     }
00234     
00236     const table*  m_ht;
00238     pointer       m_pos;
00239 
00241     friend class cache_table_const_iterator<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>;
00242 
00244     friend class cache_table<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>;
00245 };

00412 template < class Value, 
00413            class Key,
00414            class DiscardFunction,
00415            class HashFunction, 
00416            class KeyEqual,
00417            class KeyExtract,
00418            class Allocator 
00419          >
00420 class cache_table
00421 {
00422 public:
00423     typedef Key             key_type;
00424     typedef Value           value_type;
00425     typedef HashFunction    hasher;
00426     typedef KeyEqual        key_equal;
00427     typedef KeyExtract      key_extract;
00428     
00429     typedef size_t            size_type;
00430     typedef ptrdiff_t         difference_type;
00431     typedef value_type*       pointer;
00432     typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
00433     typedef value_type&       reference;
00434     typedef const value_type& const_reference;
00435     
00436     typedef cache_table_iterator< Value, Key, DiscardFunction, HashFunction,
00437                                   KeyEqual, KeyExtract, Allocator
00438                                 > iterator;
00439     typedef cache_table_const_iterator< Value, Key, DiscardFunction, HashFunction,
00440                                         KeyEqual, KeyExtract, Allocator
00441                                       > const_iterator;
00442         
00443     typedef Allocator allocator_type;
00444     
00445 private:
00446     HashFunction      m_hasher;
00447     KeyEqual          m_key_equal;
00448     KeyExtract        m_key_extract;
00449     Allocator         m_allocator;
00450     DiscardFunction   m_discard;
00451     
00452 public:
00453     
00454     hasher hash_funct() const { return m_hasher;    }
00455     key_equal key_eq()  const { return m_key_equal; }
00456         
00457 public:
00458 
00459     cache_table()
00460         : m_num_elements( 0 ),
00461           m_num_collisions( 0 ),
00462           m_empty_key_is_set( false ),
00463           m_table( 0 ),
00464           m_empty_key(),
00465           m_empty_value()
00466     {
00467         m_buckets = round_to_power2( MM_DEFAULT_TABLE_SIZE );
00468         m_mask = m_buckets - 1;
00469 
00470         init();
00471     }
00472     
00473     cache_table( size_type n, const hasher& hash, const key_equal& ke )
00474         : m_hasher( hash ),
00475           m_key_equal( ke ),
00476           m_num_elements( 0 ),
00477           m_num_collisions( 0 ),
00478           m_empty_key_is_set( false ),
00479           m_table( 0 ),
00480           m_empty_key(),
00481           m_empty_value()
00482     {
00483         m_buckets = round_to_power2( n );
00484         m_mask = m_buckets - 1;
00485 
00486         init();
00487     }
00488 
00493     cache_table( const cache_table& other )
00494         : m_hasher( other.m_hasher ),
00495           m_key_equal( other.m_key_equal ),
00496           m_num_elements( other.m_num_elements ),
00497           m_num_collisions( other.m_num_collisions ),
00498           m_empty_key_is_set( other.m_empty_key_is_set ),
00499           m_table( other.m_table ),
00500           m_empty_key( other.m_empty_key),
00501           m_empty_value( other.m_empty_value ),
00502           m_buckets( other.m_buckets ),
00503           m_mask( other.m_mask ),
00504           m_end_it( other.m_end_it )
00505     {
00506         init();
00507         insert( other.begin(), other.end() );
00508     }
00509 
00515     cache_table& operator= ( const cache_table& other )
00516     {
00517         if ( &other != this )
00518         {
00519             cache_table new_table( other );
00520             swap( *this, other );
00521         }
00522         
00523         return *this;
00524     }
00525 
00526 private:
00527     void init()
00528     {
00529         m_table = m_allocator.allocate( m_buckets * ItemSize );
00530         m_end_marker = m_table + m_buckets;
00531         m_end_it = iterator( this, m_end_marker );
00532 
00533         initialize_memory();
00534     }
00535     
00536 public:
00537     void set_empty_value( const value_type& empty_value )
00538     {
00539         assert( m_empty_key_is_set == false );
00540         
00541         m_empty_key = m_key_extract( empty_value );
00542         m_empty_value = empty_value;
00543         
00544         initialize_memory();
00545         m_empty_key_is_set = true;
00546     }
00547 
00548     const value_type& get_empty_value() const
00549     {
00550         return m_empty_value;
00551     }
00552         
00553     ~cache_table() 
00554     {
00555         clear();
00556         m_allocator.deallocate( m_table, m_buckets * ItemSize );
00557     }
00558 
00559     // INSERTIONS
00560         
00561     pair<iterator,bool> insert( const value_type& obj )
00562     {
00563         const key_type& obj_key = m_key_extract( obj );
00564         const size_t buck = m_hasher( obj_key ) & m_mask;
00565             
00566         const key_type& table_key = m_key_extract( m_table[ buck ] );
00567         
00568         if ( ! m_key_equal( table_key, m_empty_key ) )
00569         {
00570             // There's already an item in the bucket and its key it different
00571             // from the key of the inserted item.  Element is discarded.
00572             ++m_num_collisions;
00573 
00574             // Notify that the item will be discarded, to allow a policy to
00575             // do something useful with it.
00576             m_discard( m_table[ buck ], obj );
00577             _Destroy( m_table + buck );
00578             reset_value( m_table + buck );
00579         }
00580         else
00581             ++m_num_elements;
00582 
00583         // Copy the object into the hash table.
00584         _Construct( m_table + buck, obj );
00585         return pair<iterator,bool>( iterator( this, m_table + buck ), true );
00586     }
00587 
00588     template <class InputIterator>
00589     void insert( InputIterator first, InputIterator last )
00590     {
00591         for ( ; first != last; ++first )
00592             insert( *first );
00593     }
00594     
00595     // SEARCHES
00596     
00597     iterator find( const key_type& key ) 
00598     {
00599         // First of all, obtain the bucket number corresponding with the
00600         // supplied key
00601         size_t buck = m_hasher( key ) & m_mask;
00602         
00603         // Next, check that the key found in table bucket is equal to the
00604         // supplied key. If not, either the bucket is empty and so the key
00605         // wasn't found, or the bucket is hosting a different value with a
00606         // hash collision.
00607         if ( ! m_key_equal( m_key_extract( m_table[ buck ] ), key ) )
00608             return m_end_it;
00609 
00610         // else return the iterator to found item
00611         return iterator( this, m_table + buck );
00612     }
00613 
00614     const_iterator find( const key_type& key ) const
00615     {
00616         // First of all, obtain the bucket number corresponding with the
00617         // supplied key
00618         size_t buck = m_hasher( key ) & m_mask;
00619         
00620         // Next, check that the key found in table bucket is equal to the
00621         // supplied key. If not, either the bucket is empty and so the key
00622         // wasn't found, or the bucket is hosting a different value with a
00623         // hash collision.
00624         if ( ! m_key_equal( m_key_extract( m_table[ buck ] ), key ) )
00625             return m_end_it;
00626 
00627         // else return the iterator to found item
00628         return iterator( this, m_table + buck );
00629     }
00630 
00631     value_type& find_or_insert( const key_type& key )
00632     {
00633         size_t buck = m_hasher( key ) & m_mask;
00634         key_type& table_key = m_key_extract( m_table[ buck ] );
00635         
00636         if ( ! m_key_equal( key, table_key ) )
00637         {            
00638             // The bucket is either empty or it contains another item.  In
00639             // this case we have to mark it as discarded, because we cannot
00640             // know how the reference will be used ( probably to overwrite
00641             // the item with a new one that has a different key ).
00642             if ( ! m_key_equal( table_key, m_empty_key ) )
00643             {
00644                 // The bucket already contained an item. This item is
00645                 // discarded and replaced with an empty one. The destructor
00646                 // is called on it.
00647                 // The m_num_elements does not change because 
00648                 m_discard( m_table[ buck ], m_empty_value );
00649                 _Destroy( m_table + buck );
00650                 reset_value( m_table + buck );
00651             }
00652             else
00653             {
00654                 // The bucket was empty, so we have to increment the items
00655                 // counter
00656                 ++m_num_elements;
00657             }
00658 
00659             // Set the key in the empty item
00660             _Construct( &table_key, key );
00661         }
00662 
00663         // Returns the reference to the found or recently added item
00664         return m_table[ buck ];
00665     }
00666     
00667     size_type erase( const key_type& key )
00668     {
00669         iterator it = find( key );
00670         if ( it != m_end_it )
00671         {
00672             erase( it );
00673             return 1;
00674         }
00675             
00676         return 0;
00677     }
00678         
00679     void erase( const iterator& it )
00680     {
00681         if (    it != m_end_it
00682              && ! m_key_equal( m_key_extract( *it ), m_empty_key ) )
00683         {
00684             _Destroy( &* it );
00685             reset_value( it.m_pos );
00686             --m_num_elements;
00687         }
00688     }
00689 
00690     void erase( const const_iterator& it )
00691     {
00692         erase( iterator( const_cast<cache_table*>( it.m_ht ),
00693                          const_cast<pointer>( it.m_pos ) )
00694              );
00695     }
00696         
00697     void erase( iterator first, iterator last )
00698     {
00699         m_num_elements -= mm::distance( first, last );
00700         _Destroy( first, last );
00701         std::uninitialized_fill( first, last, m_empty_value );
00702     }
00703     
00704     void erase( const_iterator first, const_iterator last )
00705     {
00706         erase( iterator( const_cast<cache_table*>( first.m_ht ),
00707                          const_cast<pointer>( first.m_pos ) ),
00708                iterator( const_cast<cache_table*>( last.m_ht ),
00709                          const_cast<pointer>( last.m_pos ) )
00710              );
00711     }
00712 
00713     void resize( size_type size )
00714     {
00715         size_t new_size = round_to_power2( size );
00716         size_t old_size = m_buckets;
00717 
00718         if ( new_size == old_size )
00719         {
00720             // Do nothing
00721             return;
00722         }
00723         else if ( new_size < old_size )
00724         {
00725             // The new table will be smaller, so there's no need to rehash
00726             // all the items.
00727             value_type* new_table;
00728             new_table = m_allocator.allocate( new_size * ItemSize );
00729 
00730             // Copy the elements that fit into the new table and destroy
00731             // those that doesn't fit.  Plain old memcpy seems to have much
00732             // less problems with types than std::copy..
00733             std::memcpy( new_table, m_table, new_size * ItemSize );
00734             _Destroy( iterator( this, m_table + new_size, true ), m_end_it );
00735 
00736             m_allocator.deallocate( m_table, old_size );
00737             m_table = new_table;
00738             
00739             m_end_marker = m_table + new_size;
00740             m_end_it = iterator( this, m_end_marker );
00741             m_buckets = new_size;
00742             m_mask = m_buckets - 1;
00743 
00744             // Re-count the number of elements.
00745             m_num_elements = 0;
00746             for ( const_iterator it = begin(); it != m_end_it; ++it )
00747                 ++m_num_elements;
00748         }
00749         else // new_size > old_size
00750         {
00751             // Creates a new table and re-insert all the items, with
00752             // new buckets.
00753             cache_table other( new_size, m_hasher, m_key_equal );
00754             other.set_empty_value( m_empty_value );
00755             swap( other );
00756             insert( other.begin(), other.end() );
00757         }
00758     }
00759 
00760     void clear()
00761     {
00762         // Call the destructor for all objects and reinitialize the memory.
00763         _Destroy( begin(), end() );
00764         initialize_memory();
00765         m_num_elements = 0;
00766     }
00767 
00768     // Iterator functions
00769     iterator begin()             { return iterator( this, m_table, true ); }
00770     iterator end()               { return iterator( this, m_end_marker ); }
00771     const_iterator begin() const { return const_iterator( this, m_table, true ); }
00772     const_iterator end()   const { return const_iterator( this, m_end_marker ); }
00773     
00774     size_type size()         const { return m_num_elements; }
00775     size_type max_size()     const { return m_buckets; }
00776     size_type bucket_count() const { return m_buckets; }
00777     bool empty()             const { return size() == 0; }
00778     
00779     size_type num_collisions() const { return m_num_collisions; }
00780 
00781     // Comparison
00782     bool operator==( const cache_table& other ) const
00783     {
00784         return (    m_table == other.m_table
00785                  && m_num_elements == m_num_elements );
00786     }
00787 
00788     bool operator!=( const cache_table& other ) const
00789     { return !( *this == other ); }
00790         
00791     void swap( cache_table& other)
00792     {
00793         // Swap all the fields
00794         std::swap( m_hasher,           other.m_hasher           );
00795         std::swap( m_key_equal,        other.m_key_equal        );
00796         std::swap( m_key_extract,      other.m_key_extract      );
00797         std::swap( m_allocator,        other.m_allocator        );
00798         std::swap( m_mask,             other.m_mask             );
00799         std::swap( m_buckets,          other.m_buckets          );
00800         std::swap( m_num_elements,     other.m_num_elements     );
00801         std::swap( m_num_collisions,   other.m_num_collisions   );
00802         std::swap( m_empty_key_is_set, other.m_empty_key_is_set );
00803         std::swap( m_table,            other.m_table            );
00804         std::swap( m_empty_key,        other.m_empty_key        );
00805         std::swap( m_empty_value,      other.m_empty_value      );
00806         std::swap( m_end_marker,       other.m_end_marker       );
00807         std::swap( m_end_it,           other.m_end_it           );
00808     }
00809         
00810 private:
00811 
00813     static const size_t ItemSize = sizeof(value_type);
00814 
00816     void initialize_memory()
00817     {
00818         std::uninitialized_fill( m_table,
00819                                  m_table + m_buckets,
00820                                  m_empty_value );
00821     }
00822 
00823     void reset_value( pointer pos )
00824     {
00825         std::memcpy( pos, &m_empty_value, ItemSize );
00826     }
00827 
00829     bool is_empty_key( const_pointer& pos ) const
00830     {
00831         return m_key_equal( m_key_extract( *pos ), m_empty_key );
00832     }
00833 
00834     bool is_empty_key( pointer& pos ) const
00835     {
00836         return m_key_equal( m_key_extract( *pos ), m_empty_key );
00837     }
00838         
00840     static size_t round_to_power2( size_t n )
00841     {
00842         size_t x = 1, i = 0;
00843         while ( (i++ < 64) &&  (x < n) )
00844             x <<= 1;
00845         
00846         return x;
00847     }
00848 
00849     friend class cache_table_iterator< Value, Key, DiscardFunction,
00850                                        HashFunction, KeyEqual, KeyExtract,
00851                                        Allocator >;
00852     friend class cache_table_const_iterator< Value, Key, DiscardFunction,
00853                                              HashFunction, KeyEqual,
00854                                              KeyExtract, Allocator >;
00855         
00856     // Internal data 
00857         
00858     size_t m_buckets;          
00859     size_t m_mask;             
00860     size_t m_num_elements;     
00861     size_t m_num_collisions;   
00862     bool   m_empty_key_is_set; 
00863 
00864     value_type* m_table;       
00865     key_type    m_empty_key;   
00866     value_type  m_empty_value; 
00867     value_type* m_end_marker;  
00868     iterator    m_end_it;      
00869 };
00870 
00874 template <class V, class K, class DF, class HF, class KEq, class KEx, class A>
00875 inline void swap( cache_table<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>& ht1, 
00876                   cache_table<V,K,DF,HF,KEq,KEx,A>& ht2 )
00877 {
00878     ht1.swap( ht2 );
00879 }
